title: C04-1103

sentences.text: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration plays an important role in many multilingual speech and language applications .

In this paper , a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration that allows us to carry out direct orthographical mapping -LRB- DOM -RRB- between two different languages is presented .
Under this framework , a joint source-channel transliteration model , also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB- , is further proposed to model the transliteration process .
We evaluate the proposed methods through several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments for English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs .
Our study reveals that the proposed method not only reduces an extensive system development effort but also improves the transliteration accuracy significantly .

Entity-under_this_framework.label: Under this framework
Entity-under_this_framework.description: A novel approach for machine transliteration/backtransliteration, which involves direct orthographical mapping between two different languages and is further refined through a joint source-channel transliteration model.

Entity-the_proposed_method.label: the proposed methods
Entity-the_proposed_method.description: The novel joint source-channel transliteration models, including n-gram TM, proposed to model the machine transliteration/backtransliteration process.

Entity-joint_source-channel_transliterat.label: joint source-channel transliteration model
Entity-joint_source-channel_transliterat.description: A novel statistical framework for machine transliteration and back-transliteration, which models both the source language and channel (orthographical mapping) aspects of the transliteration process.

Entity-a_joint_source-channel_transliter.label: a joint source-channel transliteration model
Entity-a_joint_source-channel_transliter.description: A statistical framework for modeling the transliteration process between two languages, combining both linguistic and orthographical information.

Entity-several_transliterationbacktransl.label: several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments
Entity-several_transliterationbacktransl.description: A set of evaluations or tests conducted to assess the performance of machine transliteration/back-transliteration methods on specific language pairs, such as English-Chinese and English-Japanese.

Entity-novel_framework_for_machine_trans.label: novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration
Entity-novel_framework_for_machine_trans.description: A novel approach or methodology for converting text from one language to another and vice versa, using machine learning techniques.

Entity-dom.label: DOM
Entity-dom.description: A framework or tool for performing direct orthographical mappings between two different languages.

Entity-machine_transliterationback-trans.label: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration
Entity-machine_transliterationback-trans.description: A method or technique for converting text from one script to another, often involving both transliteration (converting characters) and back-transliteration.

Entity-our_study.label: Our study
Entity-our_study.description: The evaluation of a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration, including its impact on reducing system development efforts and improving transliteration accuracy.

Entity-we.label: We
Entity-we.description: The authors of this paper, evaluating their novel framework for machine transliteration/back-transliteration.

Entity-transliteration_process.label: transliteration process
Entity-transliteration_process.description: A method or procedure of converting written text from one script system into another, often involving linguistic and phonetic transformations.

Entity-novel_framework.label: novel framework
Entity-novel_framework.description: A novel approach, methodology, model, or research framework that enables the direct mapping of written texts from one language to another.

Entity-transliterationbacktransliteratio.label: transliteration/backtransliteration experiments
Entity-transliterationbacktransliteratio.description: A process of converting written texts from one script to another, with the ability to reverse this conversion.

Entity-transliteration_accuracy.label: transliteration accuracy
Entity-transliteration_accuracy.description: A measure of how accurately written text in one script or language has been converted into another.

Entity-many_multilingual_speech_and_lang.label: many multilingual speech and language applications
aliases: many multilingual speech and language applications
Entity-many_multilingual_speech_and_lang.description: Multilingual systems or tools that enable the conversion of spoken languages into written forms, or vice versa.

Entity-englishchinese_and_englishjapanes.description: A pair of languages, consisting of one instance where English is paired with Chinese, and another instance where English is paired with Japanese.

Entity-englishjapanese_language_pair.label: English/Japanese language pair
Entity-englishjapanese_language_pair.description: A pairing of two languages, typically used for translation or communication purposes.

Entity-the_transliteration_accuracy.label: the transliteration accuracy
Entity-the_transliteration_accuracy.description: The degree of correctness or precision in converting text from one script to another, as measured by comparing the original and translated texts.

Entity-multilingual_speech_and_language_.label: multilingual speech and language applications
Entity-multilingual_speech_and_language_.description: A field that focuses on developing technologies, systems, or services to facilitate communication across languages.

Entity-englishchinese.label: English/Chinese
Entity-englishchinese.description: A pairing of two languages, specifically referring to a combination of the English language with the Chinese language.

Entity-proposed_method.label: proposed methods
Entity-proposed_method.description: A set of techniques or strategies used to achieve a specific goal or solve a particular problem.

Entity-study.label: study
Entity-study.description: A systematic investigation or inquiry into a particular topic, often involving data collection and analysis.

Entity-system_development_effort.label: system development effort
Entity-system_development_effort.description: The process or task of creating and implementing a computer-based system.

Entity-an_extensive_system_development_e.label: an extensive system development effort
Entity-an_extensive_system_development_e.description: The process of developing a comprehensive and elaborate system, requiring significant resources and time.

summary: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration plays an important role in many multilingual speech and language applications . In this paper , a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration that allows us to carry out direct orthographical mapping -LRB- DOM -RRB- between two different languages is presented . Under this framework , a joint source-channel transliteration model , also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB- , is further proposed to model the transliteration process . We evaluate the proposed methods through several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments for English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs . Our study reveals that the proposed method not only reduces an extensive system development effort but also improves the transliteration accuracy significantly .

Predicate-plays_an_important_role_in.label: plays an important role in
Predicate-plays_an_important_role_in.description: Indicates that the subject has a significant influence or contribution to the object's functioning, significance, or overall impact.

Predicate-allows.label: allows
Predicate-allows.description: The predicate 'allows' indicates a relationship where the subject enables or permits the object to occur, exist, or be performed. In this context, it suggests that the machine transliteration/back-transliteration process facilitates direct orthographical mapping between two different languages.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: To evaluate means to assess or judge the quality, effectiveness, or value of something based on certain criteria or standards. The subject performs this assessment by examining and analyzing the object, which can be a method, idea, proposal, performance, etc., in order to form an opinion about its merits.

Predicate-through.label: through
Predicate-through.description: The predicate 'through' indicates a means or instrument by which something (typically an action or process) occurs. It suggests that the subject uses, employs, or operates through the object to achieve its purpose.

Predicate-reveals_that.label: reveals that
Predicate-reveals_that.description: The predicate 'reveals that' indicates a relationship where the subject (a person or entity conducting an investigation or inquiry) uncovers and presents new information about something, which is explicitly stated in the object. The connection between the subject and object is one of discovery and exposition.

Predicate-reduces.label: reduces
Predicate-reduces.description: The predicate 'reduces' indicates a relationship where the subject has a diminishing or simplifying effect on the object. This can imply a reduction in complexity, size, scope, or effort required to achieve something.

Predicate-enables.label: enables
Predicate-enables.description: The predicate 'enables' indicates that the subject has the capability or authority to facilitate or make possible the occurrence of the object. In general, it suggests a relationship where the subject provides the means, resources, or conditions necessary for the object to exist, function, or be achieved.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or example of a more general category or class denoted by the object. It represents an is-a relationship, where the subject is a narrower term within the scope of the object's meaning.
